noun.description: The institution and conducting of legal proceedings against someone in respect of a criminal charge.
examples: they lacked the funds to embark on private prosecutions
Olesky faces prosecution on charges he spied for Russian intelligence

noun.description: The continuation of a course of action with a view to its completion.
examples: the network's prosecution of its commercial ends

origin: Mid 16th century (in prosecution (sense 2)): from Old French, or from late Latin prosecutio(n-), from prosequi pursue, accompany (see prosecute).
